title: Oliver Bonas launches its biggest store outside London in Manchester
text:
What's On Oliver Bonas launches its biggest store outside London in Manchester Lifestyle and fashion store Oliver Bonas opens its huge new Manchester store today - and shoppers are in for a treat   New Oliver Bonas store opens in Manchester   What's On   
Lifestyle and fashion brand Oliver Bonas has opened its biggest shop outside London - creating an epic three-level store in Manchester city centre. 
It is the second city centre site for the firm, after the success of their first branch, which opened at Piccadilly Train Station last year. 
The huge new store opens today on St Maryâ€™s Gate, but shoppers will find the unit dramatically transformed from its former incarnation as the Joy shop. 
A team of designers have stripped back the unit to create an airy and spacious lifestyle store that showcases the full, eclectic range of Oliver Bonas products. View gallery 
That includes fashions, accessories and jewellery on the top floor, gifts and homewares on the main ground floor, and then beauty, furniture and books on the basement floor. 
Bosses have been delighted with the success of their Piccadilly store since opening last Autumn, which led to them acquiring the larger space on the main shopping drag in the city centre. Oliver Bonas store on St Mary's Gate (Photo: Manchester Evening News) Read More Are large supermarkets considerably cheaper than city centre express stores? 
It also places them right next door to one of their key competitors in the marketplace - fellow lifestyle and fashion store And Other Stories. 
The new Oliver Bonas store will be open from 9am to 8pm on weekdays, 9am to 7pm on Saturday and 11am to 5pm on Sundays. Read More
